contextId.information: This speaks about God's word as if it were a person who could know something. AT: "God's word exposes" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
Farmland that benefits from much rain is spoken of as if it were a person who drank in the rainwater. AT: "the land that absorbs the rain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the land that drinks in the rain

contextId.information: Rain and crops are seen as proof that God has helped the farmland. The farmland is spoken of as if it were a person who could receive God's blessing. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: the land that receives a blessing from God

contextId.information: Confidence is spoken of as if it were a person who could go into the most holy place of the temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
contextId.quote: confidence that enters into the inner place behind the curtain

contextId.information: This speaks about scripture as if it were a person who could witness about something. AT: "For God witnesses about him through the scriptures" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
The law is spoken of as if it were a person who could act. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

The blood of Jesus and the blood of Abel are both spoken of as if they were two persons calling out. AT: "the sprinkled blood of Jesus that says better things than the blood of Abel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: the sprinkled blood that speaks better than Abel's blood
